title: Mitre Angles (Common Cases)
summary: Quick reference for common mitre cuts with context.
whenToUse: Use for common trim and framing junctions requiring equal mitres.
howToUse: For a square corner (90°), set each mitre to 45°.
For an octagon corner (135° internal), set each mitre to 22.5°.
steps: Identify the total included angle of the corner.
Divide the included angle by two for equal mitres.
Set the saw and test-fit with offcuts.
commonMistakes: Cutting two left-hand mitres instead of left/right.
siteTips: Test with a short offcut before committing to the final piece.
Label mating pieces to keep pairs aligned.
verification: Dry-fit the mitres to confirm the corner closes cleanly.
